name: IN vs EXIST Use IN when the subquery is the most selective (PeopleSoft)
description:
Only the use of IN statement is checked.
This is the Key User or Siebel DBA duty to check if the subquery is large or not.
output:
This report lists all the PeopleSoft SQL Definitions using IN clause:
It provides the following information: 
- PeopleSoft SQL Definitions full name
rationale:
When the developer has the choice between IN and EXISTS clause in an SQL definition, then IN clause should be chosen when the subquery is the most selective.
Most selective meaning subquery results is very small.

Conversely, The EXISTS clause is much faster than IN when the subquery results is very large.
remediation: Switch to EXISTS clause when the subquery results is very large.
